meanings.definition: To launder (money) again in order to obscure its origins.
meanings.sent1: After being caught, the criminal attempted relaundering the money to avoid detection.
meanings.sent2: The illegal organization was relaundering their profits through various shell companies.
meanings.sent3: The detective chuckled at the audacity of the criminal trying to relaunder the money right under their noses.
meanings.sent4: The artist's intricate web of lies was like relaundering the truth into a beautiful illusion.
meanings.sent5: The concept of relaundering money was as shady as trying to hide a spotlight in broad daylight.

meanings.definition: The act of laundering money again in order to obscure its origins.
meanings.sent1: The relaundering of the funds was a clear attempt to cover up the illegal activities.
meanings.sent2: Authorities were investigating a case of relaundering that involved multiple offshore accounts.
meanings.sent3: The movie portrayed the relaundering process in a comical light, much to the audience's amusement.
meanings.sent4: The relaundering of the money was like trying to bury a secret in a sea of lies.
meanings.sent5: The news article described the relaundering scheme in vivid detail, exposing the complexity of the operation.
